trans-unit.source: Converts an integer to and from an object by applying the integer as an index to a list of objects.
You can use the AlternationConverter to bind a property to alternating values.

For example, if you want items in a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ListBox> to have alternating blue and light blue backgrounds, you do the following: - Create an AlternationConverter and add a blue <xref:System.Windows.Media.SolidColorBrush> and a light blue <xref:System.Windows.Media.SolidColorBrush> to its <xref:System.Windows.Controls.AlternationConverter.Values%2A> property.

- In a <xref:System.Windows.Style> for <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ListBoxItem>, bind the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Control.Background%2A> property to <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.AlternationIndex%2A?displayProperty=fullName> and assign the converter you created to the <xref:System.Windows.Data.Binding.Converter%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.AlternationConverter"></xref> class.
Converts an integer to an object in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.AlternationConverter.Values*> list.
The integer to use to find an object in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.AlternationConverter.Values*> property.
The type of the binding target property.
The converter parameter to use.
The culture to use in the converter.
The object that is in the position of o modulo the number of items in .
Converts an object in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.AlternationConverter.Values*> list to an integer.
The object to find in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.AlternationConverter.Values*> property.
The type of the binding target property.
The converter parameter to use.
The culture to use in the converter.
The index of o if it is in , or â€“1 if o does not exist in .

Gets a list of objects that the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.AlternationConverter"></xref> returns when an integer is passed to the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.AlternationConverter.Convert*> method.
When you use the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.AlternationConverter> to bind a property to alternating values, the Values property contains the objects that are assigned to the property.

For example, if you want items in a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ListBox> to have alternating blue and light blue backgrounds, you add a blue <xref:System.Windows.Media.SolidColorBrush> and a light blue <xref:System.Windows.Media.SolidColorBrush> to Values.

A list of objects that the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.AlternationConverter"></xref> returns when an integer is passed to the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.AlternationConverter.Convert*> method.
